intro: Rafnia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and includes species such as Rafnia africana and Rafnia capensis. The plants typically have sturdy stems, narrow leaves, and produce small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. Rafnia species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their resilience and attractive appearance. They are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them suitable for xeriscaping.
